JobFullDesc: About Us:At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, by combining our vast resources and investments we are able to dedicate ourselves to solving mission-level vs. product-level customer challenges – together we can anticipate more, move faster and make a bigger impact on the big picture. Whole Life Engineering (WLE) is responsible for ensuring our products are Safe, Reliable, Maintainable and delivered on time.  WLE consists of multiple disciplines that support engineering, our program offices and our customers.  Our WLE disciplines participate in the total life cycle of our products from conception to deactivation.  Our focus area is product support, including the following disciplines:  Reliability System Safety and Supportability.Do you have work experience in the fields of: System Safety Engineering; or Energetics, Explosives, or Propellant Safety; or Battery Safety; or Software or Firmware Engineering; or equivalent Safety Engineering Experience (e.g. Aerospace Safety, Automotive Safety, or Medical Device safety engineering)?  If so this may be the opportunity for you!Job Summary:System Safety Engineering is a department of Whole Life Engineering. Our team sets system requirements, analyzes the design, assesses test data, reviews operating and maintenance manuals, and assess risk by way of hazard analyses, and software and firmware safety programs. System safety provides assurance to our employees, the customer and end users that our products safely perform their required mission functions throughout their lifecycle while meeting overall cost and schedule requirements. We’re a stable, employee focused team operating in a dynamic, change-oriented environment. We methodically analyze missile and defense programs at a component and system level to identify, eliminate or mitigate hazards, As a member of the team, you’ll collaborate across departments, including Engineering, Environmental Health & Safety, Supply Chain, Operations, Test & Integration and Production. As a Principal Systems Safety Engineer, your responsibilities will include:Analysis of engineering hardware and electrical drawings and schematics assessing for fault tolerance, latent hazards, and safety requirements complianceWork with test and tactical operating and maintenance procedures to assure the proper administrative controls are in placeWork across all integrated product teams and lines to properly eliminate hazards or provide effective controls. Collaborating with Program Management and government approval authorities from program startup through production to demilitarization and disposal. Responsibilities to Anticipate:Key Responsibilities will include:Perform MIL-STD-882E System Safety Program tasks and analyses, or customer’s approved equivalentDesign Analyses, Influence, and Verification via conduct of fault tree analyses, hazard analyses, sneak circuit analyses, and software and firmware safety analysesManage one large system safety program or multiple mid-sized safety programs to include:Monitoring program technical execution, interfacing with stakeholders (e.g. customers, program offices, subcontractors, vendors, etc.), performing Earned Value Management, and Systems Engineering tasksEffectively managing the System Safety Program and tasking of personnel as assignedMentoring Jr. Engineers in the field of System SafetyGaining Customer Safety Approval for Test or DeploymentPreparing Safety Assessment Reports and Safety Program Briefs for Customer ApprovalBriefing safety of the program at technical reviews and as part of the safety approval processInterpretation of system requirements, customer specifications and military standards to have appropriate safety requirements for hazard mitigation or elimination approvedPreparation of internal and customer reports describing various analyses relevant to the System Safety programCollaborating across multiple disciplines to gain a full understanding of product architecture and design An advanced degree in a related field and minimum 5 years experience may be considered for this role.
